website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if the 3-tools-in-1 appeals to you, but standard models outperform their capabilities, especially for tough jobs.
pros: Stands out for its unique 3-in-1 design – it's a trimmer, edger, and mower that's ideal for small yards
The lightweight tool comes with 2 batteries
cons: The batteries drain quickly, resulting in diminished power
Has the tendency to miss tall, thick grass and weeds

website_summaries.verdict: For small yards, this cordless 3-in-1 mower easily handles lawn trimming and edging tasks, but it can drain a battery charge quickly.
pros: Trimmer’s single-feed cord is easier to refill than double feed
Setup out of the box is almost instant
Adjustable shaft and light weight makes mower much more comfortable to use
cons: Battery doesn’t always last through a single mow
Wheels must be manually adjusted up and down when setting for grass height
Has trouble with grass higher than 2 inches
Some found it mows unevenly and needs multiple passes

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing - it is so lightweight and easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing - it is so lightweight and easy to use. It's downright fun to transform it from a string trimmer to a mower and back. It handles everything I need it to in my small front and back yards and the whole unit is lighter than the string trimmer I used to have. In tight spots, I can just pick up the whole unit to turn it around rather than the three point turn I used to do with my very heavy reel mower. It's easy to hose down the mower dock after use. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Black and decker should be ashamed!  Very ashamed!
customer_reviews.text: I give no stars for this item. I have never been so unimpressed with a big name item. But today I opened up the biggest disappointment. This plastic piece of garbage won’t cut anything. I’m not sure how it has any good reviews at all. It does nothing. It’s the biggest waste of money unless you need something to fan your grass. Otherwise you are screwed. I am not sure how this is even on the market. I’m so so so furious. Great job black and decker. You fooled another customer! Shame on u!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: A Problem Solver and a Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: This Mower/Weeder solved the problem of clipping the grass under the weeping trees in the yard. It is also great for getting under the evergreen branches that grow down to the ground. I am able slip under them and get any shade tolerant weeds that spring up. My favorite feature is that is it friendly to this old man's back....no more bending, I can stand upright when using it with the mower attachment. The battery lasts a long time between charges (20 minutes). Having a second battery is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Elder Techie

customer_reviews.title: Light weight So Easy
customer_reviews.text: I cut the grass in the front yard myself, for the first time ever! This thing is so light weight and easily operates with one hand. Then pops out to clean edges/weeds. It's not loud and noisy. Come w/2 batteries, one was more than enough for me. Instructions say to wear safety glasses (at lease some shades )when weed wacking and that's good advice. I'm proud of myself. And I look forward to using it again, next month. Smart product. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: GinaBonina

customer_reviews.title: This is a good idea - but not this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but this one needs a lot of improvements. The trimmer is too weak. I often had to go over a spot several times to get a good cut. Batteries drain fast and take too long to charge. You will need more than the two batteries. It needs to be more powerful and better batteries. I would certainly buy one of these in a better quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Buderowe

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for Small Yards
customer_reviews.text: This 3 in 1 mower/trimmer is great for small spaces. It is super convenient, lightweight and easily storable. For people with small lawns and limited storage space, this is an ideal product. I am using this for a small 10’x12’ lawn that also requires edging and trimming. I don’t think I would recommend this for medium sized lawns. Mower: works well. I wish it had a bit higher cut length. The cut is not as precise as a traditional mower but it does a decent job. Weed whacking/trimming/edging: more than adequate for light to medium duty work. Battery: I can mow, weed whack, and edge all on one battery. My yard takes about 20min to do all three.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and multifunctional
customer_reviews.text: I am a 60 yr old disabled woman, and we recently relocated and our new home has a yard. It's not a huge yard, but everyone keeps up on theirs, so I didn't want to be odd woman out. I got this and am happy to see how easy it is to use, it is lightweight, great as a mower, but when using it as a weewhacker/edger it starts to really make you realize you need to work on your arms! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Cameo C. Massey

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Revolutionary. I can’t believe no one thought of this before. Plenty of pros and no cons. Assembly literally takes just ten minutes. I’m 71 and I cut my backyard of approximately 1200 sq ft in 20 minutes. The cut is even and the mower is so easy to push. There’s really nothing to it. Think about it. No oil or gasoline to store. No moving parts to repair. It’s plastic! If something breaks, just replace it. Honestly, there is nothing to dislike. My wife said, “Even I can do this”. Heh heh. That’s what I thought too. Buy it. If you don’t agree, send it back. I’m bettin you’ll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A joke!
customer_reviews.text: This is a joke. The best thing to do with this is take the string off and give to your kids as a toy. Seriously. I would give this a -2 star score if it were possible. I was not at all pleased with this piece of garbage. As a fact, I've seen toy weed eaters that were sturdier. Hubby was trying to cut some tall grass when I got home and it couldn't do returned it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Highly impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small yard so bought this to get rid of 4' tall weeds my husband has been too lazy to pull. I had been going through cancer so not able to do yard work. Now donenwith all that. Anyway I used this and was so freaking impressed with the power to mow down those pesky thick weeds!!! I love the adjustable length and having two batteries even though the power lasts quite a long time on one battery! Also very light and easy to handle. I have not tried the mower attachment yet but I have no doubt this little machine will work well for a while. Perfectfor my tiny yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: It was made in china from cheap plastic. Forget about mowing grass, it is a trimer on a flimsy piece of plastic and no it's made for about ten cents in material. This in not worth buying. China gave us the virus then they sold this shit and as long as we buy it were the idiots . I think its time to buy American Made and cut there throat we need quality not cheap junk. mike
customer_reviews.author: michael c murphy

customer_reviews.title: The right widget for small backyards!
customer_reviews.text: You have to wonder why no one came up with this earlier! It's perfect for small backywards. A few caveats: - Get yourself an additional battery. ( more is essential. - You have to find your style for your yard. It's not a mower. We go in straight lines, one direction and back. Then "vacuum" over spots that we miss. - The finish result is not "manicured". Think like your hair with only, no buzzer. There's a lot of variation. - We also bought the rapid charger as well, because the OEM sucks. ( That one star miss is for the crappy charger, uneven finish, and the need for an additional battery. But all in all, it's all we need.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul G. Sabnis

customer_reviews.title: practical useful great tool
customer_reviews.text: Quite a useful, light and practical tool. Sure it's not useful for large lawns, but otherwise it's useful and suprisingly effective. Pros - Light, easy to use, easy to assemble, two batteries (To charge one while using the other - mandatory - if you want to be able to finish the job in one mow). change from weed-wacker to lawn mower easily. useful on non straight surfaces - because it's so light. I use it at the drop by the brook. Cons- battery short life. 15 min. Need to push twice to cut grass - which bends under the motion (normal stuff) reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is the short battery life. enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Theizzy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be much better
customer_reviews.text: The two small batteries (2.0 AH) are marginal. Used up two fully charged batteries and had to recharge one battery for 4 hours to finish trimming (still didn't quite finish - mail box post grass still needs trimming). B&D needs to provide 5.0 AH batteries at a slightly higher price. The mower deck is a great thought, but is built with too little clearance in the back - it is always dragging. Handle needs to be longer - only great for a child or small adult. While has marginal power, it is fairly light and with upgraded batteries will do an adequate job.
customer_reviews.author: ROM

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Genius concept for tiny lawns. I was using a real blade mower and I was never totally satisfied with the results. This mower is awesome! I don't have to worry about curves, edging issues, uneven levels, pinecones, sticks, etc. I don't have to rake after either!! The grass is cut and mulched so fine. It comes with 2 batteries and a small charger. The string is already installed and ready to go. Super easy to use! I ordered extra string and the faster charger. Good to have. My front yard (6'x14') and back yard (14'x24') are small, so I was able to mow both yards 3 times before the first battery lost power.
customer_reviews.author: Shadoekat

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, and as much power as a gas trimmer. Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I hit the wrong key and could not finish my review, so here it is again. It comes with 2 lithium ion batteries which last about 20 min each. That was plenty of time for me. It has as much power as my old gas trimmer, rather amazing. The wheels are very useful if you don't have hidden branches in the weeds (which I did). A big feature for me was it's low weight. I love this thing. If you want to save money, buy the one without the wheels, but if you have an unobstructed area they will be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: F. Keene

customer_reviews.title: Has Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight Serves as good weedeater and edger Does decent job of mowing Advances the twine automatically when it breaks. Cons If your grass is at all thick it drains the battery quickly I have a postage stamp sized yard and cannot do it on two batteries Goes thru the twine somewhat quickly and the replacement twine is approx $7 at Lowes, I end up using about two of them a month - that adds up. I have to push it back and forth, like a vacuume cleaner several times in thick grass to get it all cut. If you were thinking of trying it you might want to order an extra battery up front.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D.

customer_reviews.title: Unusable because it cannot assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The guard does not fit onto the weed trimmer like it should. It *should* slip on and snap into place and it doesn’t slide all the way on. You cannot tighten the screw in the correct place. Both pieces are mass manufactured so replacing one part or the other is unlikely to help. Customer service took 7 minutes to transfer from an International call center to an agent who put me on hold 30 minutes ago. They said “it’s hard” but you “have to push”. Well I already tried that, and took some plastic off both the guard and the weed trimmer with the extra screwdriver I used for the effort of trying to make it fit/pry it on.
customer_reviews.author: POTS, MD

customer_reviews.title: Makes Hard To Get To Areas Easy
customer_reviews.text: We have a large ditch that is very slanted which can't be mowed with a riding mower and for my wife and I over 70 had become almost impossible to get mowed. We tried using a regular weed whacker but that was difficult and very time consuming. I saw this Black and Decker string combination lawn mower and trimmer on Amazon and thought we might give it a try. What a relief, my wife love s using it and the ditch which used to be a demon to get done is now done in minutes. It has also been useful in many other areas of had to get into areas of the yard. Great yard tool, we highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Sibley

customer_reviews.title: It's a good weed wacker but wheels are week
customer_reviews.text: It is a great wacker when used separately but the wheel support is made of plastic. Because of the pushing and pulling during mowing the lawn, it will come apart or bend enough to make it hard to cut your grass. I used this in my back yard and used up about 4 batteries just to finish a medium size job. If the support was somehow stronger and tougher then I would make this purchase great and item useful. After using this 2-3 times I would say that I wish I did not buy this and I would not buy again. Better to get just the wacker by itself and not get it as a combo.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Win

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea but Cheap Flimsy Plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but super flimsy! I'll be surprised if this last a season. The trimmer itself is fine but the mower attachment is very flimsy plastic. If there is any resistance the trimmer pops out of the mower attachment although this might be a good thing to keep from breaking the flimsy plastic mower attachment. In fact the mower attachment is so weak it can barely hold the trimmer up when the trimmer is attached to the mower. I'm guessing on a really hot and sunny day the cheap plastic mower attachment will bend and break. Oh well, it was a good idea just really cheap execution.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a small, calling it a lawn would be stretching it. The trimmer moves easily, is light and easy to manuver. If one is a perfectionist, it's not the answer. I don't think it will do well on a large green lawn. I live in SW New Mexico and don't water my lawn so I am usually just trimming so it's perfect for me. I was able to finish trimming on one charge (just). It lasted as long as I wanted to trim. It worked perfectly for me. Like I said earlier, if you want a green carpet of a lawn, it probably won't be satisfactory for you. It's perfect for me. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: It started out great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY unhappy with this 3 in 1 mower. It worked great the first 2 times I used it. On the 3rd use the weed whacker would no longer attach to the mower deck, so I could only use it as a weed whacker. I decided I could deal with that. BUT when I went to use it the 4th time it would start up nice and strong and 3 seconds later it would stop. I tried changing the battery out, changing the string spool, etc. IT WILL NOT RUN FOR MORE THAN 3 SECONDS!!! On top of that the the return window closed just a day or two before all of this happened!!!
customer_reviews.author: Woofie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: Like this machine. Its a lithium battery trimmer for edging that comes with a small flat that's used for main grass areas. Ideal for my small front yard. Its lightweight and easy to use. Not for large lawns of course as its a trimmer being used as a mower. No bag or disposal of course. A bit tricky to get the trimmer to fit into the cart first time, but once you get it done then it comes on and off just fine to use as trimmer or 'mower' mode. I bought the extra speed charger upgrade. Charge lasts about 30 minutes. Frankly if using longer then you need a proper mower. Good idea and well designed!
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tight spots and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my situation. Much more robust than my previous electric trimmer. I need a portable mower for tight spots and my steep hill. I have several batteries so that's never a problem but you will need at least the 2 batteries it comes with before you get tired. Supplied charger is slow charger but I have this mower and a hedge clippers and 2 extra batteries so not a problem. Really impressed with the lifetime of the string wheel. Very durable. Might be the "gear drive". You use it like a vacuum cleaner. It's cool!
customer_reviews.author: J Pond

customer_reviews.title: Sucks as a mower; trimmer is ok if you have a small space.
customer_reviews.text: We have a tiny yard and I thought this would be a great alternative to a regular gas powered push mower- wrong. The deck isn’t adjustable in any way and it didn’t cut the grass short enough (it kind of just laid it over) and took two full battery charges despite our minuscule yard. I ended up just throwing the deck away and using the trimmer to “mow” until we purchased a regular push mower. I will say the trimmer works great as just a trimmer, but if you had a very large space to trim the battery doesn’t last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Astarr

customer_reviews.title: Love this new tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Battery life is not great but you do get 2. I needed this to cut areas between the flower beds that are too narrow for my lawnmower. Works for my needs. We did “mow” one half of the backyard to test this out. Works okay, but won’t replace a lawnmower for a big yard. I do use it as a weed eater too and the battery seems to last forever when used for that, but it goes quickly when you use it as a lawnmower. The battery takes 3-4 hours to charge so I recommend starting with both batteries fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: FL Girl

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use our 9 yr. old can mow the grass, safely.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little mower (string trimmer). It's so lightweight our 9 yr. old can mow the grass. It transforms very quickly from mower to string trimmer. It does a great job on our 1/4 acre lot. It comes with a slow charger and one battery. We did buy the fast charger and a second battery. It only lacking in one area and that it tall grass, it slows it down and causes it to use batteries more quickly. We mow our grass about every 5 days and the battery lasts 30-45 minutes. It takes about 3 batteries to mow our 1/4 acre lot. I hope this information helps someone. Thanks, Chris
customer_reviews.author: Smeeb

customer_reviews.title: Helps me get more done
customer_reviews.text: This does what I wanted it to do. My yard is an acre. There’s a lot of trimming and there are some slopes that I have trouble doing with the big mower. While I still have to use the string trimmer, having the capability to use four wheels takes a strain off of my back and I can get so much more done before I give out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design for weak arms/ hands but all plastic ?!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it- surprised that its entirely plastic - even wheels! Literally feels like pushing a childs toy. But it is exactly what i need to get the trimmer around the yard. Im weak and cant hold it for long so this sortof cart mower piece is fantastic for me. Trimmer pops in and out of cart in seconds with a foot pedal !! Just not sure how well the plastic wheels and housing will hold up. (Trimmer is light enough for average person to hold)
customer_reviews.author: C S

customer_reviews.title: Best yard trimmer I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I've used this multiple times and my yard borders on the forest so it's not a well manicured lawn. This buzzes through the edges and is wonderfully lightwieght. My old trimmer was heavy and I could only trim half the yard at a time because it wore me out. It is under one acre with lots of trees and flower boxes to trim around. This one is a breeze. I'm not sure where they will look for the tool but I've had 2 neighbors stop and ask me what it was, sounded like a trimmer but looks like a small lighweight mower. It is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Buy more batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trimmer because I am a woman who does not have the strength to pull a cord and did not want to fight with an electrical cord .....You definitely need two batteries and the quick charge . The charger that comes with it takes hours to charge . Even with the charged battery you do not have an hours power to work with. That said ,it is easy to use,light weight and does a good job. Another plus .is it has a self feeding line ,no bumping .....It actually feels like a toy ,and really doesn't look to me that it will last long because everything is light weight plastic. I guess we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: sugar babe

customer_reviews.title: Battery operated Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Battery Operated. I have 2 drills and the circular saw. This came with 2 batteries and charger. It is a powerful little thing. I love the mower feature and how it pops right out as a weed eater. Snapping it back in takes me crouching down and using two hands. It has 2 clips that have to line up but it's not hard. I use it at my RV lot to keep weeds down and not to have to deal with people tearing my stuff up. Definitely worth it. A weed eater a lone would cost this. It's a super little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I tend to mow once a week and the grass gets just a bit too long to go over in one easy pass, so i tend to use the vacuum ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to mow a townhouse yard approximately 20'X30', and it does okay for that, if i keep the grass low i can get the entire yard mowed on one battery in about 15-20 minutes. I tend to mow once a week and the grass gets just a bit too long to go over in one easy pass, so i tend to use the vacuum cleaner motion (back and forth over the same spot) to get all of the grass cut, but can still get my yard done on one battery. Definitely not a great replacement for a real lawn mower if you have a larger yard, but works well for my situation.
customer_reviews.author: travdaddy78

customer_reviews.title: It will not last long & the Inc, is not good.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I bought the first one caught on fire & I spent six & half hours on the phone & did not get a full refund.The reason I bought another was because I had already bought more string. The foundation for the weed eater dose not hold up well it comes apart & is not covered by square trades & I didn't know this I spent several days & hours on the phone only to find out it wasn't covered.The string is hard to put in & the batteries don't last long if you use the foundation to weed eat it doesn't cut the grass short enough.
customer_reviews.author: ruth b.

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I needed it for....
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Would only use on a small yard though or a yard that is overly grown. Battery lasted for the mow and edging. Again, wouldn't use on overly grown grass or huge yards. That's what lawn mowers are for. If you accept this. It will work for what you need it for. Good and quick yard tool.
customer_reviews.author: Joey B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and modular. Runs through fully charged batteries very quickly though. Unlike using the same battery for a drill which lasts a very long time, I go through 2.5-3 batteries for mowing/edging my 1/4 acre lot (that’s to be expected with it constantly running). The biggest downfall is the small tab that locks the weedwacker shaft into the mower base is a thin peice of plastic on a thin lip, so if you’re going over uneven surfaces, or lifting it up often, they easily become separated. For the price, and for small yards it’s great though! I recommend buying an extra charger and keeping 2-3 batteries fully charged though.
customer_reviews.author: SteveOH

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT for small lawns!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE? Great for a small townhouse lawn. Easy too take apart too use the other functions. Only need one hand too use. If you are looking for an average looking cut this is the one, but if looking for a gold green look, maybe not. Just remember it is using string not blades. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND! We are very satisfied with the cut. Also, another good point, is the grass does blow out, it goes straight down, so it doesn’t blow into the landscaping, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I would only recommend this if you want to have a safer way to allow your little kids to help with lawn mowing chores or if you have a very small yard. Each battery last about 15 minutes. Doesn't cut through a little bit longer grass well. It is kinda like a vacuum and you have to keep moving it back and forth. Doesn't cut wet grass or damp grass very well. Does come with charger and two batteries. Mower deck pops off sometimes randomly. Edger function works well as does weed whacker.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good line trimmer, light-duty, mower deck is good for vacuum motion over lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent line trimmer. Edges nicely, normal weed-wacking use is fine for light duty, and the mower base is pretty slick for light mow jobs. Prior reviewer nailed the mowing function - think of it like vacuuming (not traditional mowing) your yard. Helps to work it back & forth and go over areas multiple times. Works best when used regularly to mow when grass isn’t too long, can chew through battery life if taller grass. For routine/weekly quick maintenance the mower portion works pretty well, the lightweight feel is nice, and you can zip through a small area pretty well. Heavy duty it isn’t, but it IS a pretty neat idea, good battery life, and a fairly versatile tool.
customer_reviews.author: A. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards
customer_reviews.text: We are renting a townhome in Virginia with mostly weeds posing as grass in our small backyard. This product was perfect for our purposes. I love how lightweight it is, especially with how many tough and awkward spaces we have to work with in our yard. I was satisfied with the end result. It was pretty even, with a few stragglers I went over a second time. The battery lasted as advertised so I had to use two charges worth of battery to cover my lawn, which didn't bother me. If you are expecting the same result as a regular lawnmower, you may be disappointed, but like I said it's perfect for my circumstances and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Galura

customer_reviews.title: Husband hates it, i love it!
customer_reviews.text: I would seriously give this 5 stars if the batteries lasted longer. It’s so easy to use. It’s like vacuuming the yard. I’m a teeny tiny person, and i can use this without problem. We have a few batteries and a few chargers, and we just have to cycle the batteries, that’s the only downside. I can do the backyard with one battery and the front with maybe 3 (the grass grows better in the front). For small yards, this is your best bet! My husband hates it because it takes batteries, but he can just suck it up 😂
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would’ve bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: We have a backyard that is dominated by our small pool with a little bit of grass behind the pool and on the side of our house. I hated dragging the lawnmower around the pool to try to cut a 20’x5’ area, so this thing totally solves that problem. It honestly feels like vacuuming, and it also saves time because you can just pop the weed eater off and go straight to trimming and edging. It would be a pain to cut normal sized yards with this thing, but if you have smaller areas that need more than a string trimmer but less than a mower, this is the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R.

customer_reviews.title: So lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure I haven't actually used this "the man" has. I did watch the assembly and have seen it in use. So lightweight, good for small yards. I am in an urban city row house/town house. It doesn't work if your grass is really high but a cut once a week or every two weeks is easily attainable with this mower. It comes with two batteries and one has lasted the entire mow of our small yard. The trimmer has been great for lawn shaping we haven't tried it on anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight for those with back problems
customer_reviews.text: Battery time was too short....rather, I suppose I should have ordered a larger trimmer. I use it, it's great for "spot" checking your landscaping but my yard is just too big for this. I do like that I can get way up under my larger shrubs and it gets into small tight places where a regular trimmer would eat up your flowers. I am able to eliminate some uncomfortable weeding by using this. Make sure you clean it good after using it as a mower.
customer_reviews.author: Brisco

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lawnmower for my Mom, that lives in Mexico. She has a hernia and was no longer able to pull the cord on her traditional mower because it caused her so much pain and it became hard for her to push it around. She lives alone and so I wanted to get her a mower that was light weight and battery operated. She absolutely loves this mower and has just been raving about it. The extra battery comes in handy. As you can see by the photos, she’s been able to clean up her yard quiet easily and pain free. She wanted to make sure I gave this mower 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Addictive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I am not one for writing product reviews, as a matter of fact, this is my very first review on Amazon. This small electric mower/trimmer is simply amazing. I hadn't cut my grass in several weeks due to being out of town and with the grass as long as it was, I was very skeptical that this little mower could do the job. Much to my surprise I was able to mow, trim and edge a small area of around 600 square ft without any issues and the battery has juice for plenty more work. Comes with two batteries so longevity will not be a problem for most smaller yards. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Best option for a small lawn
customer_reviews.text: I have a house on a very small lot, which is taken up by a parking pad and tiny garden. I only need to mow the parkway. Before fi ding this gem, I tried a push reel mower. It was a disaster. No matter how many times I went over the area, it was patchy and awful looking. This mower base weed whacker cuts the lawn quickly and evenly. For my small space, it is the perfect tool. The only thing I would change is to have an on switch that doesn't require me to hold it on the entire time I'm mowing (it's like a cordless drill), which gets old fast.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product couldn't work better. Surprised at how good it works. I am a 62-year-old woman live alone have a 2 acre farm this little machine is great for doing my trim around the fence and around the shrubs . I cannot believe how fantastic it works as a little lawnmower /Weedwhacker . I have used a lot of products in my years but this little thing is fantastic . I was so sure it was just a gimmick and I would not be thrilled with it but boy was I ever wrong !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerJoan Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quicky
customer_reviews.text: So this is my 10 year old first lawn mower. The big motor one scare him and my self. Its very easy to move around. Has a safety button. Wheels are durable and bigger than most. Has a depth adjustment for height of grass. Perfect for hilly,rocky, around planters and fish pond beds. I do recommend using a blower to get the debris out before storing. Easy to put together. 2 batteries were plenty for our odd areas lasting about an hour each battery 2 hours total.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably Awmazing
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked by the ease of use, effectiveness and long lasting battery (I didn't even have to use the second one - both of which my wonderful wife had charged in advance the night before for me to use first thing this morning). Literally mows, trims and edges like full powered gas units - too bad for the expensive competition! I cannot say enough good things about this product, and I do not often write reviews. Best Father's Day gift ever!
customer_reviews.author: MartinQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming around flowers!
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for safely trimming between the hostas using it as a tiny mower and then in an instant it converts to a regular string trimmer for other work. The battery lasts so long I haven’t yet had to switch to the second one while working. UPDATE: The battery life is really good. I have a small yard but do quite a bit of trimming. I’ve found I can trim 2 - 2 1/2 times before the battery dies. I just pop it on the charger, grab the other one, and I’m good to go for a couple more times.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Exceeds expectations. I have a townhouse and the only way to access the bank yard is through the basement and up steps. Because this is so light it’s perfect. The lightness also helps with maneuverability. I have a west tangled bumpy back yard. It did a great job tackling it all. You use it more like a vacuum than a mower, as in a back and forth motion. I have some back issues andBeing able to switch hands and lift easily was a dream. Definitely get two batteries as the charge will only complete a small yard. Assembling it was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: StellarTexas

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poorly executed. With the wheels on, it won't cut tight to a fence or wall, meaning you'll have to remove it from the base if you want to trim where your regular mower won't reach. Kinda defeats the purpose of having wheels, doesn't it? And it's just too light-duty for anything substantial like a ditch or around a culvert. My wife wanted something easier on her back (she's getting oooold) and this could have been the perfect trimmer, but the design and..... well, the cheap build quality had us returning it after one use. Too bad because it looked so promising.
customer_reviews.author: TJH

customer_reviews.title: It's a good 2 in 1....
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I read other reviews here prior to purchasing this. Many claimed that this is good for a small yard. I thought my front yard was small enough, but apparently the two batteries told me another tale. It took both batteries to do a poor job on half of my front yard. This is apparently not up to the task I had for it...cutting grass. The edger/trimmer are the best part of this along with the weight. If you're looking to cut a small well manicured area, then this would probably work just fine. Other than that..,buy a real lawnmower. 2 stars for the 2 functions and that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lane

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: It is made for women who don't like working with heavy equipments. It is light but cuts through weeds and tall grasses with ease. It is small enough to mow grasses growing in tight narrow areas, between bushes, and flower beddings, and under benches, where a zero lawn mower can not access. I am very happy with it, because I have my own toy to use around my garden, not completely relying on my husband who use big heavy mean machines.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tycoon

customer_reviews.title: B&D SHOULD BE ASHAMED
customer_reviews.text: This item is a waste of money because the battery life is absolutely deplorable! You were mean more than three batters and more than two chargers to complete a small front and backyard! Of course, I returned it with no problem, but buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: M. Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 5 star because I think it rates it as it functioned as I think it is designed to do. It is perfect for a small yard...would do the whole yard, but I have a big yard. I do work fast to make the batteries last. I have "mowed" some really high grass. Trimmer is great. Very easy to convert. Not too heavy. The only downside I have is you have to constantly press the button to run the thing and my hands are small. I wish they made good tools for "lady" hands.
customer_reviews.author: bembie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight LawnCare
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mothers awkward cramped back yard and so she wouldn’t be using a heavy machine and we are both super surprised and pleased at how well this super light and useful mini lawnmower/weed trimmer/edger works! It comes with two batteries and a charger and the charge holds quite a while. I wouldn’t suggest it for a large yard or a first go at weeks of unkept lawn but for a medium to small yard that has been maintained well this is literally perfect and is super lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, but it’s small. Great for tiny yards or if you’re limited on storage. I do wish it was more powerful. I have some areas that get thick and I have to hit them a couple times. When I use this I feel like I’m vacuuming my yard lol. I would recommend the larger batteries, they provide you longer run time, however not more cutting force. There is also an identical model that you plug in instead of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton7c

customer_reviews.title: saving a fortune
customer_reviews.text: Never mowed my own lawn before I found this handy mower! Saving lots that I used to pay to have it done!!! So lightweight. I just keep it to simple mowing and occasionally will use the trimmer. Perfect for those of us getting on in years!!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my gardening tools!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this item two years ago. I loved it...! It's lightweight, did the job, reliable...it does what it claimed. Then I had to purchase a 2nd one...only because my son kept borrowing the first one I had purchased and never returned it. I use the BLACK+DECKER 3-in-1 Lawn Mower, String Trimmer and Edger, 12-Inch (MTC220) to maintain the overgrown path in the woods where I walk my 3 Golden Retrievers. It is a workhorse !!! Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is awful
customer_reviews.text: This is a very convenient little mower if you have a teeny tiny yard, but the battery life deteriorates VERY quickly. We used to be able to get most of our yard done (~45 minutes total out of 2 fully charged batteries), but after about 6 times using the mower, the batteries now only last a total of 30 minutes. I have to mow over 3-4 days, now, and it's awful. If you want to go electric, buy one that plugs in.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for me
customer_reviews.text: 1st time out worked surprisingly well. Smallish lot surrounding house. Mowed fine but was spectacular on weeds and edges. It is made almost all of plastic so that was a concern as far as fit and durability. A little trouble snapping battery into seated place but once running it was a beast. Highly recommended for similar situations.
customer_reviews.author: luee

customer_reviews.title: Not good for mowing!
customer_reviews.text: We have three small sections of lawn only, so we thought this morning would be perfect. It is not. We didn’t realize there is actually no blade in the mower. It simply uses the string from the weedeater. If you have more than one 10 x 10‘ lawn, this morning for you. It does a poor job knowing and the price dropped about $40 a week we bought it and Amazon would not give us a price correction. We disposed of the box so we couldn’t even return it for a refund. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for small spaces, more power than my electric one
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to start a pull cable lawn mower. EVER. At 65, it's never gonna happen. I have a very small back yard with tight areas that are too big for regular sized lawn mowers. I push it like a vacuum cleaner and just separate it for weed-eating. Using both batteries, I can weed-eat the entire front lawn, after mowing, then go to the the backyard and finish everything. I LOVE THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.author: Therese

customer_reviews.title: Battery life limitations.
customer_reviews.text: The cordless 3-in-1 black and decker product is incredible, lightweight and simple to use. The cut as a mower is even, but sometimes may require a twice over. The weed eater will effectively hack into big brush, and trim up around the walls really well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because each buttery only lasts about 10 minutes but take 4-5 hours to charge. If this thing came with 60v batteries, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good Product. HORRIBLE BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: We bought it because it seemed to be a good option for us who do not have a big lawn. This product brought us at an inexpensive price a trimmer and a lawn mower kind of product. It was easy to set up. Its light. BUT THE BATTERIES ARE THE WORST I HAVE EVER SEEN. It came with two batteries and each one lasted when knew about 45' each. Now, after 6 uses they last no more than 30' and I am being generous. With these two batteries we can't finish the lawn. Now I have to get into AMAZON again to but a larger battery.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo R.G.

customer_reviews.title: good for small yard.
customer_reviews.text: we used to have corded 120V version of this , liked very much until it quite after 5 years of use. so bought this one. also bought spare non-oem 6AH battery . battery come with it last about 15 minutes of use. I like it better than normal lawn mower with real metal blade, because string blade is much forgiven, and easier to replace. very light unit, about same weight of vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Agness

customer_reviews.title: good job black and decker
customer_reviews.text: For a guy with a small yard like me and someone that hates messing with gas and pull starts, it really does what I need it to do. It's like a little weedwacker with wheels. Relatively quiet in case you cut your grass at night to beat the heat or in case you just work on an off shift. Batteries that came with it did the job for about 2 months. After that, I needed more juice since I wasn't getting done with the yard before juice ran out. Got at least 12 mows in and didn't even use up the first spool.
customer_reviews.author: joe blob

customer_reviews.title: I can't decide
customer_reviews.text: the trimmer/edger does its job, and for certain areas of my yard or in a pinch, the added lawnmower features with wheels is ok. But I'm not sure if its worth it. It doesn't seem to stay together and in place all that well and I have to 'fix' it, as I'm mowing several times. Maybe there is a better lock feature I am missing doing. Also, I had some trouble putting it together as others have noted.
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: As edger is okay...if you looking for lawn mower look for a different one
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lawnmower and came across this that combines n edger feature. As edger is fine but as mower is not working like described. I'm disappointed for another $80/100 I could have bought a nice lawn mower....my back yard is very small...and I tried in longer grass but in very short grass and it worked the same.
customer_reviews.author: Clelia Fricano

customer_reviews.title: This should have 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, it should really have 5 stars. Right off the bat I tackled a badly overgrown yard that I wasn’t sure it could handle. It did, to my joy. It Is so lightweight, so easy to use that this 57 y/o woman who had never mowed a lawn much less edged or weed eated used it to on that over grown yard with great ease. I’m VERY satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and give a nice even trim in hard-to-reach areas
customer_reviews.text: This black and decker weed whacker with wheels was easy to assemble and gives my lawn an even cut around the shrubs and lilac trees by the street. My self-propelled push mower was awkward to maneuver between and around the shrubs. This made quick work of trimming the shrubs by the street (where it shows) and gave it a nice even look.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: The handle isn't comfortable
customer_reviews.text: As a mower it is very bad and works best as a trimmer, but despite that the battery is very fast, I have a garden of 10 x 20 feet and I had to use 2 batteries and I could not finish the job, also the handle is also not very comfortable because it does not have a pin or accessory to keep it on and you have to be holding the power button all the time since otherwise it turns off. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Theira

customer_reviews.title: Great value, convenient and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Buy it with the right expectations. This is not a heavy duty mower. You do need to go over the same patch twice, at times. However, this is very easy to maneuver, economical considering you get a trimmer with this, convenient since this is cordless, and takes up less space when you store it since it's relatively small. It does a good job. In one battery charge I was able to cover up to a 900 sq of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek

customer_reviews.title: A must buy.
customer_reviews.text: I love this set up. Sure it’s just a B&D trimmer but combined with the 4 wheel cart makes it as useful as can be. They give you 2 LI batteries and charger. The trimmer can be used separate from the cart with just a push of a pedal. If you have a small area that is not worth using a mower on, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: RobertF

customer_reviews.title: Handy and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Received today, put it together in about 15 minutes, charged the battery up, and tried it out. Biggest advantage for me is the light weight. I'm 81 and was able to carry it across walkway obstructions easily. I mowed my approximately 10 x 40 lawn using the mower like a vacuum cleaner. It did a right decent job of easy mowing, I then detached the weed eater from the base and finished the job with one battery. Seems to be of decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B. Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed With Under P/owered Performance
customer_reviews.text: I already use a B&D battery string trimmer & it works well. I thought this would be a solution to some hard to mow areas with a consistent level cut. Problem is it's extremely under powered. My yard is approx 1 acre and I also thought that this would relieve arm fatigue since the weight rests on the wheels. Wrong again. It struggles to cut through spring grass and overall was a waste of money. Sorry B&D. I really wanted to like it.
customer_reviews.author: karencolleen

customer_reviews.title: Great For Small Yard
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our small yard at our apartment and it has served its purpose. It is not the most high-tech, but it's dual-functionality has made life much easier. We needed a trimmer for around our fence, but a mower for the rest of the yard. When we found this, it was the perfect solution. My only complaint is the battery life. I wish the batteries were stronger than 20 V and held more charge. I go through 2 batteries each time I mow, and if the grass is longer than normal, my 2 batteries don't allow me to finish the yard.
customer_reviews.author: JBro

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: As a trimmer, it does a great job. Having 2 batteries is nice. As a mower, almost worthless. Barely cuts grass. There needs to be some way the unit sits lower to the ground when using the mower attachment. My guess is the grass must be at least 4" tall to get any semblance of a cut. You're much better off buying a low-end mower, if that's your intent.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Great for seasonal camping!
customer_reviews.text: For the way I use it its outstanding! I am a seasonal camping and have a small lot does great. The disadvantage is while on mower deck holding the button all the time. But safety first! I break a lot of things running over things like hoses and cords but no damage to them! It take about 20 minutes to mow this lawn with alot of weeds lake fishing relaxing and did I say fishing
customer_reviews.author: dale

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it almost....
customer_reviews.text: ....more than she loves me. That's good enough. I consider it $$ well spent. Observing her and it, it does what it should do and it does it well. (Much better than I would have thought) Wife reports that pushing the weed-eater on wheels is almost effortless. I was already a fan of the 20volt B&D battery system of tools. Oh! My older 20volt B&D weed-eater with the wheel guided edger also attaches to mower base and operates. Its all good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Worden

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The weed whacker itself is great. Lightweight and easy to carry and manuever. The base with wheels doesn't hold up too long. The 'lug nuts' holding them on snap off easy and the wheel falls off. It's plastic so it's junk when it breaks. The company will replace it no problem but I personally don't use the wheels. There's also no setting for height and it will cut the grass very short which will eventuall kill it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: A versatile edger for tight spots. A handy all-in-one for postage stamp yards.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to mow my little rental postage stamp on a full battery, then used some of a second battery to do the trimming. It even cut down the overgrowth that was there when we moved in. Now that we've acquired a slightly larger yard (7000sqft, which took the energy of six batteries to mow), battery life has relegated this little guy mostly to edging and trimming, and the mower attachment still comes in handy for near bushes, narrow spaces, or areas I'd rather not maneuver the mower around. Still going strong after three years.
customer_reviews.author: Nice Hat Harry

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like that this lawn mower is quite portable and runs on rechargeable batteries. Docking one star because the height cannot be adjusted high enough. The wheel are too low and will result in cutting your grass too low which is not great for optimum lawn care. I want my lawn grass to be tall enough to withstand and resist weed attacks and the height on this unit doesn't let that happen. I dont really like dealing with gasoline and all the other headaches of the bigger mowers and this device takes away all that stress
customer_reviews.author: Adewale

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to cut a small courtyard that has grass between the pavers. I have 9 acres of woods and have used the weed eater portion on all the heavy weeds, some are super think and it cuts right through it. It does a better job then my husbands huge gas weed eater. I wouldn’t probably use it to cut an entire yard. It is too small for that. Also, I have a disc problem in my back and this being so light weight doesn’t bother it. The only thing to point out is the batteries don’t last that long like other reviewers have mentioned. I plan to buy extra ones to extend the time.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teaching kids to mow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a safe option for my kids to help with yard care. It is a weed whacker with a mower attachment that acts as a very large guard for debris and keeps the cut even. It's super lightweight. My 7 year old can even work it easily. It's like vacuuming your yard. I didnt like the plastic wheels at first. . But it keeps my kids from digging the wheels into the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Angi Vale

customer_reviews.title: HA I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: HA I love this thing! Bought this because I put my larger mower on a moving truck and I'll be without it for a few weeks. I thought I could use it in the interim and then keep for smaller projects at the new house. Wow - it's great! Someone compared it to a vacuum cleaner, and it's exactly like that! Lightweight, charged quickly, and easy to use. Results were no different than my larger mower. Great tool. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Light
customer_reviews.text: This is good for small lawns. It's a great alternative for someone who doesn't want to hassle with fueling a mower. It's very light for someone who has difficulty pushing a big mower. It is best for small areas. It feels kind of like vacuuming the lawn, but it's lightweight and easy to move around. It's also handy to have the trimmer attached, so you've got just one tool to store. Changing out the batteries and converting to a trimmer are the most challenging aspects of using it, and at that it's simple enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Real reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It's like a toy, but it does the work. I'm glad it came with two batteries, because I use the heck out of it. It lasts about 20 minutes time, and I can do a lot in that time. I have cut our side yard with just this little guy, and the grass was pretty tall. The only down side is that sometimes it comes out of the wheel base too easily. Other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Foo

customer_reviews.title: Know what you’re buying.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small backyard. Go ahead and buy this item. It is really comfortable and easy to use. If you have a decent sized backyard and front yard. Don’t waste your time. You will be struggling to cut your grass. I had this item for one day before I returned it. I went through both batteries in less than one hour. I’m very disappointed because I was actually excited for this product. Great idea, extremely disappointing design. The fact that it’s a plastic base you’ll spend more time attaching the trimmer to the base than actually mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rossi

customer_reviews.title: A breeze to use !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first weeder and I love it. It is very lightweight and easy to use.The batteries take 4 hours each to charge and only last between 15-30 minutes each.I still can’t imagine dealing with any other mowing trimmer.The mowing deck makes this item worth it.The edger works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine L Smith

customer_reviews.title: I call it my toy.
customer_reviews.text: Living with all men, I was always complaining that I couldn't do my own weed eating around my gardens because I can't hold the darn standard weed eaters. They're heavy and kill my back. I found this and call it my toy. It's so easy to use and I love the fact that it's battery operated. I don't need to monkey around with gas or chords. I love it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: surprising results
customer_reviews.text: I waited till I used this a few times before reviewing. It felt kind of cheap out of the box, but I assure you, it's a little worker. My wife cut our small fenced yard in no time while I cut a different part of the yard. She can get that little mower and trimmer into places my mower wont fit and the battery lasts a decent amount of time, based on the height and thickness of the grass. It's great for steeper inclines a riding mower can't go and it separates for the trimmer easily. Worth using for a smaller yard
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: THE WEED WACKER PART WON'T STAY ATTACHED TO THE ROLLING BASE
customer_reviews.text: IT NEEDS TO BE MORE SECURELY ATTACHED. POOR ENGINNERING. ALSO THE STING IS NOT STAYING THE CORRECT LENGTH FOR MORE THAN 2 MINUTES IF THAT. BLACK AND DECKER IS NO HELP. dtHEIR SERVICE PEOPLE ARE NOT FAMILIAR WITH IT. WE WILL TRY TO GET THE STRING TO STAY IN POSITION AND WILL CORRECT REVIEW IF IT DOES. GREAT IDEA IF ENGINEERING WAS DONE PROPERLY. WE USE WEED WACKERS JUST FINE AND THEY ARE BLACK AND DECKER.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery after 1.5 months, can't return, no customer service phone
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some hassle and look for a better product. Amazon customer support told me there is no phone number and the windows for return is already gone after 1.5 months of use. And the only way to contact black and decker is by a form. You are on your own with this one... the link provided by Amazon to contact Balck and Decker is to join an email list...
customer_reviews.author: The Berries

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to buy two
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of this kit for my mother last year as her mower for a trailer. It has done Soo well doing all her weeding and mowing I had to buy one as a trimmer/detail mower. Too good of a product for detail work or small yards. Be careful to not overheat it on big work, but take advantage of the black and Decker ecosystem of their 20v batteries. Makes a huge benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Claypool

customer_reviews.title: Can not attach weed whacker to mower base
customer_reviews.text: We are unable to attach the weed whacker to the mower base, although we tried many dozens of times, even watching YouTube videos to see if possibly we were doing something wrong. We then called our handyman in for help, and he was also unable to solve this problem, saying that the mower is obviously defective. We contacted Black & Decker and got an email response that someone would get back to us. That was several days ago. Yesterday, we sent B & D a photo of the gap which results when we try to attach the whacker. Still no response. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Cheris

customer_reviews.title: Buy as a trimmer, not a mower substitute
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use as a mower for a small yard; however, unless the grass is very short it will not cut higher grass (and I'm not talking overgrown, just won't cut higher normal grass). No longer using as a mower but just for the weed wacker. I would give the weed wacker five-stars except for the handle constantly falls out of the setting (probably 2-3 times per use). Not a big deal, just a minor inconvenience. As a mower: 1 star As a weed wacker 4 stars (5 if handle was not a problem)
customer_reviews.author: M. Francis

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 3-in-1 Lawn Mower, String Trimmer and Edger, 12-Inch (MTC220)
product_meta.description: Style:20V 3-in-1 Lawn Mower KitAll in one lawn mower, string trimmer, and edger. Offering the ultimate in small yard and garden versatility, the innovative BLACK+DECKER 3 N 1 trimmer/edger and mower gives you three types of landscaping functionality in a single, compact tool. Thanks to its small footprint design, this an ideal mower, string trimmer, and edger for homes with small yards of up to 1,200 square feet, as well as yards with small inclines or difficult to reach areas. It's also a great solution for homes with limited storage space. This model (MTC220) offers cordless freedom, but it's also available in a corded version so you can choose the right option for your yard. No bumping required with Auto Feed System. Cordless Freedom The cordless 3 N 1 trimmer/edger and mower includes two 20 volt MAX lithium ion rechargeable batteries. 1 BLACK+DECKER's 20 volt MAX lithium ion batteries offer a longer lifespan and retains its charge 5x longer than similar 18 volt NiCd batteries. They're compatible with the full line of BLACK+DECKER's 20 volt MAX line of power and gardening tools, and you won't be limited by an extension cord. Easy to use and maneuver, the battery powered 3 N 1 eliminates the need for gas or oil to be stored. Ultimate Versatility The 3 N 1 features a durable mower base deck with four wheels that secures a BLACK+DECKER string trimmer/edger with a 12 inch cutting swath. A foot pedal release allows for quick insertion and removal of the trimmer/edger as you move from mowing to trimming or edging. The mower deck also features two height adjustment options that raises or lowers all four wheels.
